biogHist.abstract: Patricia (Pattie) Leighton was a Western Australian nominee for the ABC Rural Woman of the Year Award in 1994. She and her husband established a property in the Cape Rich area, north-east of Albany, W.A., in 1966.

chronItem.event: Nominated for ABC Rural Woman of the Year in W.A.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Leighton, Patricia', in The Australian Women's Register, National Foundation for Australian Women and The University of Melbourne

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Pattie Leighton interviewed by Ros Bowden in the Women of the land oral history project

archref.repository: National Library of Australia, Oral History and Folklore Collection
archref.unittitle: Pattie Leighton interviewed by Ros Bowden in the Women of the land oral history project
archref.abstract:
Patricia "Pattie" Leighton, a farmer, speaks of growing up in Sydney, moving to Tasmania, her marriage, their first farm near Hobart, their decision to move to Western Australia, her trip across with the children, early days on the farm, living in the shed, early development of the land, tough financial times, re-entering the workforce as a preschool teacher, returning to the farm, shearing, further development of the farm (incl. their living quarters), the importance of the children working on the farm, their independent upbringing, the Wellstead community, the local Historical and Heritage Committee, reafforestation and land conservation, the continuing challenges of rural life, and the Rural Women of the Year Award.
Interview conducted 1995

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Women of the land oral history project

archref.repository: National Library of Australia Oral History Collection
archref.unittitle: Women of the land oral history project
